FuncDef:
The quota-out command configures the policy that the device takes against the online users who use up their quotas of traffic or session time.
The undo quota-out command cancels the current configuration.
By default, the policy is to deactivate the service.

ParaDef.Info:
Configures the policy to be redirection and specifies the HTTP redirection template name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Configures the policy to be redirection.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The quota-out means when the local quotas are used out, the device sends an application for more quotas but the server denies to allocate quotas to it. There're two types of the quota-out policies. HTTP-redirection, and deactivating the service.
Prerequisites
When the quota-out policy is redirection, the referred HTTP redirection template should have been configured already.
Configuration Impact
When the policy is HTTP-redirection, the HTTP application of the service will be redirected to a certain page.
When the policy is deactivating the service, the service will be deleted. The traffic of this service will be matched with other services or users.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
